page.title: 17INFORMATION SYSTEMS
page.content: BUILDING MAINTENANCE The Becon system,which stands for Building ECONomics,is for establishments such as schools, libraries and other centres to report building maintenance problems.If a problem occurs the head of centre rings up BECON and gives the required information,such as the address of the establishment, the nature and location of the problem and how urgent its repair is.The operative then feeds the information into the computer and the computer will select a suitable firm to rectify the problem.The operator then either phones up the contractor or if not too urgent sends the information by post. The contractor comes to do the work and the head signs a slip to say the work has been finished and is satisfactory.
